metadata.name: FACT_TOKEN_TRANSFERS
metadata.comment: [BETA TABLE] - This table contains events on the Ethereum Blockchain with an event name of 'Transfer'. The contract address is the token transferred, and the raw amount field is the amount of tokens transferred. Please note this amount is not decimal adjusted. Decimal adjustments for a token address can be found in ```dim_contracts```. This table will not contain transfers of native ETH.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This will not be unique in this table as a transaction could include multiple transfer events.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: CONTRACT_ADDRESS
CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Contract address of the token being transferred.

FROM_ADDRESS.name: FROM_ADDRESS
FROM_ADDRESS.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The sending address of this transfer.

TO_ADDRESS.name: TO_ADDRESS
TO_ADDRESS.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The receiving address of this transfer. This can be a contract address.

RAW_AMOUNT.name: RAW_AMOUNT
RAW_AMOUNT.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The amount of tokens transferred. This value is not decimal adjusted.

_LOG_ID.name: _LOG_ID
_LOG_ID.comment: [BETA TABLE] - This is the primary key for this table. This is a concatenation of the transaction hash and the event index at which the transfer event occurred. This field can be used to find more details on the event within the ```fact_event_logs``` table.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: EZ_SWAPS
metadata.comment: [BETA TABLE] - This table will contain all swap events done on the Sushiswap platform in the ```fact_event_logs table```, joined along with the addresses of both tokens in the swap and the decimal adjusted prices.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: CONTRACT_ADDRESS
CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The address interacted with for a given event.

EVENT_NAME.name: EVENT_NAME
EVENT_NAME.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The decoded event name for a given event.

AMOUNT_IN.name: AMOUNT_IN
AMOUNT_IN.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The amount of tokens put into the swap.

AMOUNT_OUT.name: AMOUNT_OUT
AMOUNT_OUT.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap.

SENDER.name: SENDER
SENDER.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The Router is the Sender in the swap function.

TX_TO.name: TX_TO
TX_TO.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The tx_to is the address who receives the swapped token. This corresponds to the "to" field in the swap function.

EVENT_INDEX.name: EVENT_INDEX
EVENT_INDEX.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Event number within a transaction.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: [BETA TABLE] - This field denotes which application the liquidity pool belongs to.

TOKEN_IN.name: TOKEN_IN
TOKEN_IN.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The address of the token sent for swap.

TOKEN_OUT.name: TOKEN_OUT
TOKEN_OUT.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The address of the token being swapped to.

SYMBOL_IN.name: SYMBOL_IN
SYMBOL_IN.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The symbol of the token sent for swap.

SYMBOL_OUT.name: SYMBOL_OUT
SYMBOL_OUT.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The symbol of the token being swapped to.

AMOUNT_IN_USD.name: AMOUNT_IN_USD
AMOUNT_IN_USD.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The amount of tokens put into the swap converted to USD using the price of the token.

AMOUNT_OUT_USD.name: AMOUNT_OUT_USD
AMOUNT_OUT_USD.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap converted to USD using the price of the token.

_LOG_ID.name: _LOG_ID
_LOG_ID.comment: [BETA TABLE] - This is the primary key for this table. This is a concatenation of the transaction hash and the event index at which the event occurred. This field can be used within other event based tables such as ```fact_transfers``` & ```ez_token_transfers```.

bytes.label: Approximate Size
bytes.description: Approximate size of the table as reported by Snowflake

clustering_key.description: The key used to cluster this table

metadata.name: FACT_BLOCKS
metadata.comment: [BETA TABLE] - This table contains block level data for the Ethereum Blockchain. This table can be used to analyze trends at a block level, for example gas fees vs. total transactions over time. For more information, please see [Etherscan Resources](https://etherscan.io/directory/Learning_Resources/Ethereum) or [The Ethereum Organization](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/blocks/)

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The date and time at which the block was produced.

NETWORK.name: NETWORK
NETWORK.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The network on the blockchain used by a transaction.

BLOCKCHAIN.name: BLOCKCHAIN
BLOCKCHAIN.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The blockchain on which transactions are being confirmed.

TX_COUNT.name: TX_COUNT
TX_COUNT.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Total number of transactions within a block.

DIFFICULTY.name: DIFFICULTY
DIFFICULTY.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The effort required to mine the block.

TOTAL_DIFFICULTY.name: TOTAL_DIFFICULTY
TOTAL_DIFFICULTY.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Total difficulty of the chain at a given block.

EXTRA_DATA.name: EXTRA_DATA
EXTRA_DATA.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Any data included by the miner for a given block.

GAS_LIMIT.name: GAS_LIMIT
GAS_LIMIT.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Total gas limit provided by all transactions in the block.

GAS_USED.name: GAS_USED
GAS_USED.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Total gas used in the block.

HASH.name: HASH
HASH.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The hash of the block header for a given block.

PARENT_HASH.name: PARENT_HASH
PARENT_HASH.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The hash of the block from which a given block is generated. Also known as the parent block.

MINER.name: MINER
MINER.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Miner who successfully added a given block to the blockchain.

NONCE.name: NONCE
NONCE.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Block nonce is a value used during mining to demonstrate proof of work for a given block.

RECEIPTS_ROOT.name: RECEIPTS_ROOT
RECEIPTS_ROOT.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The root of the state trie.

SHA3_UNCLES.name: SHA3_UNCLES
SHA3_UNCLES.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The mechanism which Ethereum Javascript RLP encodes an empty string.

SIZE.name: SIZE
SIZE.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Block size, which is determined by a given block's gas limit.

UNCLE_BLOCKS.name: UNCLE_BLOCKS
UNCLE_BLOCKS.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Uncle blocks occur when two blocks are mined and broadcasted at the same time, with the same block number. The block validated across the most nodes will be added to the primary chain, and the other one becomes an uncle block. Miners do receive rewards for uncle blocks.

BLOCK_HEADER_JSON.name: BLOCK_HEADER_JSON
BLOCK_HEADER_JSON.comment: [BETA TABLE] - This JSON column contains the block header details.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: EZ_TOKEN_TRANSFERS
metadata.comment: [BETA TABLE] - This table will contain all events in the ```fact_token_transfers table```, along with joined columns such as token price, symbol, and decimals where possible that allow for easier analysis of token transfer events. Please note Native ETH transfers are not included here.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This will not be unique in this table as a transaction could include multiple transfer events.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: CONTRACT_ADDRESS
CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Contract address of the token being transferred.

FROM_ADDRESS.name: FROM_ADDRESS
FROM_ADDRESS.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The sending address of this transfer.

TO_ADDRESS.name: TO_ADDRESS
TO_ADDRESS.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The receiving address of this transfer. This can be a contract address.

RAW_AMOUNT.name: RAW_AMOUNT
RAW_AMOUNT.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The amount of tokens transferred. This value is not decimal adjusted.

DECIMALS.name: DECIMALS
DECIMALS.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The number of decimal places this contract needs adjusted where token values exist. For example, use the decimal field to correctly transform raw amounts in ```fact_token_transfers```.

SYMBOL.name: SYMBOL
SYMBOL.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The symbol used to represent this contract. Please note this is not necessarily unique.

TOKEN_PRICE.name: TOKEN_PRICE
TOKEN_PRICE.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The price, if available, for this token at the transfer time.

AMOUNT.name: AMOUNT
AMOUNT.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The decimal transformed amount for this token. Tokens without a decimal adjustment will be nulled out here.

AMOUNT_USD.name: AMOUNT_USD
AMOUNT_USD.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The amount in US dollars for this transfer at the time of the transfer. Tokens without a decimal adjustment or price will be nulled out here.

HAS_DECIMAL.name: HAS_DECIMAL
HAS_DECIMAL.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Whether or not our contracts model contains the necessary decimal adjustment for this token.

HAS_PRICE.name: HAS_PRICE
HAS_PRICE.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Whether or not our prices model contains this hourly token price.

_LOG_ID.name: _LOG_ID
_LOG_ID.comment: [BETA TABLE] - This is the primary key for this table. This is a concatenation of the transaction hash and the event index at which the transfer event occurred. This field can be used to find more details on the event within the ```fact_event_logs``` table.

bytes.label: Approximate Size
bytes.description: Approximate size of the table as reported by Snowflake

clustering_key.label: Clustering Key
clustering_key.description: The key used to cluster this table

row_count.label: Row Count
row_count.description: An approximate count of rows in this table

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: EZ_DEX_SWAPS
metadata.comment: [BETA TABLE] - This table will contain all swap events in the ```fact_event_logs table```, joined along with the addresses of both tokens in the swap, the decimal adjusted prices, and the platform used for the swap.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: CONTRACT_ADDRESS
CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The address interacted with for a given event.

EVENT_NAME.name: EVENT_NAME
EVENT_NAME.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The decoded event name for a given event.

AMOUNT_IN.name: AMOUNT_IN
AMOUNT_IN.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The amount of tokens put into the swap.

AMOUNT_IN_USD.name: AMOUNT_IN_USD
AMOUNT_IN_USD.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The amount of tokens put into the swap converted to USD using the price of the token.

AMOUNT_OUT.name: AMOUNT_OUT
AMOUNT_OUT.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap.

AMOUNT_OUT_USD.name: AMOUNT_OUT_USD
AMOUNT_OUT_USD.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap converted to USD using the price of the token.

SENDER.name: SENDER
SENDER.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The Router is the Sender in the swap function.

TX_TO.name: TX_TO
TX_TO.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The tx_to is the address who receives the swapped token. This corresponds to the "to" field in the swap function.

EVENT_INDEX.name: EVENT_INDEX
EVENT_INDEX.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Event number within a transaction.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: [BETA TABLE] - This field denotes which application the liquidity pool belongs to.

TOKEN_IN.name: TOKEN_IN
TOKEN_IN.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The address of the token sent for swap.

TOKEN_OUT.name: TOKEN_OUT
TOKEN_OUT.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The address of the token being swapped to.

SYMBOL_IN.name: SYMBOL_IN
SYMBOL_IN.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The symbol of the token sent for swap.

SYMBOL_OUT.name: SYMBOL_OUT
SYMBOL_OUT.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The symbol of the token being swapped to.

_LOG_ID.name: _LOG_ID
_LOG_ID.comment: [BETA TABLE] - This is the primary key for this table. This is a concatenation of the transaction hash and the event index at which the event occurred. This field can be used within other event based tables such as ```fact_transfers``` & ```ez_token_transfers```.

metadata.name: DIM_LABELS
metadata.comment: This table contains labels for addresses on the Ethereum Blockchain.

CREATOR.name: CREATOR
CREATOR.comment: The name of the creator of the label.

ADDRESS.name: ADDRESS
ADDRESS.comment: Address that the label is for. This is the field that should be used to join other tables with labels.

ADDRESS_NAME.name: ADDRESS_NAME
ADDRESS_NAME.comment: This table contains labels for addresses on the Ethereum Blockchain.

LABEL_TYPE.name: LABEL_TYPE
LABEL_TYPE.comment: A high-level category describing the addresses main function or ownership.

LABEL_SUBTYPE.name: LABEL_SUBTYPE
LABEL_SUBTYPE.comment: A sub-category nested within label type providing further detail.

metadata.name: DIM_CONTRACTS
metadata.comment: [BETA TABLE] - This table contains contract details for contracts deployed on the Ethereum blockchain.

ADDRESS.name: ADDRESS
ADDRESS.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The unique Ethereum address of the deployed contract.

SYMBOL.name: SYMBOL
SYMBOL.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The symbol used to represent this contract. Please note this is not necessarily unique.

NAME.name: NAME
NAME.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The name of the deployed contract. Please note this is not necessarily unique.

DECIMALS.name: DECIMALS
DECIMALS.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The number of decimal places this contract needs adjusted where token values exist. For example, use the decimal field to correctly transform raw amounts in ```fact_token_transfers```.

CONTRACT_METADATA.name: CONTRACT_METADATA
CONTRACT_METADATA.comment: [BETA TABLE] - This JSON column contains other relevant details for each contract.

metadata.name: DIM_CONTRACTS_EXTENDED
metadata.comment: [BETA TABLE] - This table contains contract details for contracts deployed on the Ethereum blockchain.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The block number at which the contract was read and details recorded.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The block timestamp at which the contract was read and details recorded.

CREATOR_ADDRESS.name: CREATOR_ADDRESS
CREATOR_ADDRESS.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The address of the contract creator.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: CONTRACT_ADDRESS
CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The unique Ethereum address of the deployed contract.

LOGIC_ADDRESS.name: LOGIC_ADDRESS
LOGIC_ADDRESS.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The logic address, where applicable.

TOKEN_CONVENTION.name: TOKEN_CONVENTION
TOKEN_CONVENTION.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The token standard utilized by this contract.

NAME.name: NAME
NAME.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The name of the deployed contract. Please note this is not necessarily unique.

SYMBOL.name: SYMBOL
SYMBOL.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The symbol used to represent this contract. Please note this is not necessarily unique.

DECIMALS.name: DECIMALS
DECIMALS.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The number of decimal places this contract needs adjusted where token values exist. For example, use the decimal field to correctly transform raw amounts in ```fact_token_transfers```.

CONTRACT_METADATA.name: CONTRACT_METADATA
CONTRACT_METADATA.comment: [BETA TABLE] - This JSON column contains other relevant details for each contract.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: FACT_EVENT_LOGS
metadata.comment: [BETA TABLE] - This table contains flattened event logs from transactions on the Ethereum Blockchain. Transactions may have multiple events, which are denoted by the event index for a transaction hash. Therefore, this table is unique on the combination of transaction hash and event index. Event names are decoded in this table where possible. The event inputs column will contain the log details in JSON format. Specific fields can be pulled from this column using the following sample format: ```event_inputs:<FILED_NAME>::<DATA TYPE> as <FIELD_NAME>```.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.

EVENT_INDEX.name: EVENT_INDEX
EVENT_INDEX.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Event number within a transaction.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: CONTRACT_ADDRESS
CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The address interacted with for a given event.

CONTRACT_NAME.name: CONTRACT_NAME
CONTRACT_NAME.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The name of the contract or token, where possible.

EVENT_NAME.name: EVENT_NAME
EVENT_NAME.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The decoded event name for a given event.

EVENT_INPUTS.name: EVENT_INPUTS
EVENT_INPUTS.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The decoded event inputs for a given event.

TOPICS.name: TOPICS
TOPICS.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The un-decoded event input topics.

EVENT_REMOVED.name: EVENT_REMOVED
EVENT_REMOVED.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Whether the event has been removed from the transaction.

_LOG_ID.name: _LOG_ID
_LOG_ID.comment: [BETA TABLE] - This is the primary key for this table. This is a concatenation of the transaction hash and the event index at which the event occurred. This field can be used within other event based tables such as ```fact_transfers``` & ```ez_token_transfers```.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: FACT_TRANSACTIONS
metadata.comment: [BETA TABLE] - This table contains transaction level data for the Ethereum Blockchain. Each transaction will have a unique transaction hash, along with transactions fees and an ETH value transferred when applicable. Transactions may be native ETH transfers or interactions with contract addresses. For more information, please see [The Ethereum Organization - Transactions](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/transactions/)

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The date and time at which the block was produced.

BLOCK_HASH.name: BLOCK_HASH
BLOCK_HASH.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Block hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generate when a block is produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed.

NONCE.name: NONCE
NONCE.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The number of transactions sent from a given address.

POSITION.name: POSITION
POSITION.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The position of the transaction within the block.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.name: ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The function signature of the contract call.

FROM_ADDRESS.name: FROM_ADDRESS
FROM_ADDRESS.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The sending address of this transaction.

TO_ADDRESS.name: TO_ADDRESS
TO_ADDRESS.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The receiving address of this transaction. This can be a contract address.

ETH_VALUE.name: ETH_VALUE
ETH_VALUE.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The value transacted in Ether.

TX_FEE.name: TX_FEE
TX_FEE.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Amount paid to validate the transaction in Ether.

GAS_PRICE.name: GAS_PRICE
GAS_PRICE.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Cost per unit of gas in Gwei.

GAS_LIMIT.name: GAS_LIMIT
GAS_LIMIT.comment: [BETA TABLE] - Maximum amount of gas allocated for the transaction.

CUMULATIVE_GAS_USED.name: CUMULATIVE_GAS_USED
CUMULATIVE_GAS_USED.comment: [BETA TABLE] - The total amount of gas used when this transaction was executed in the block.

INPUT_DATA.name: INPUT_DATA
INPUT_DATA.comment: [BETA TABLE] - This column contains additional data for this transaction, and is commonly used as part of a contract interaction or as a message to the recipient.

TX_JSON.name: TX_JSON
TX_JSON.comment: [BETA TABLE] - This JSON column contains the transaction details, including event logs.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table
